page.title: 09GOVERNMENT 03800597
page.content: The main organ of Government is the {Parish Council}elected every 4 years approximately. It consists of 8 {locally elected Councillors,}4 each from Rochester and the forestry village of Byrness. The Rochester representatives are 2 retired farmers 1 housewife and a M.O.D. patrolman. {Meetings}are held every 6 weeks, alternately in each village hall. The council is allotted a percentage of the local rates to be spent on{local} projects.Recent{grants}have been given towards the installation of a T.V. mast to improve reception, and to provide a handrail for a flight of stone steps. They also deal with footpaths, grass verges, local bus services and any requirements of the residents in the parish.Housing,roads and larger issues are referred to Tynedale District Council.
